1.text: Can you draw out the leviathan with a hook, and can you bind his tongue with a cord?

2.text: Can you place a ring in his nose, or bore through his jaw with an arm band?

3.text: Will he offer many prayers to you, or speak to you quietly?

4.text: Will he form a covenant with you, and will you accept him as a servant forever?

5.text: Will you play with him as with a bird, or tether him for your handmaids?

6.text: Will your friends cut him into pieces, will dealers distribute him?

7.text: Will you fill up bags with his hide, and let his head be used as a home for fishes?

8.text: Place your hand upon him; remember the battle and speak no more.

9.text: Behold, his hope will fail him, and in the sight of all, he will be thrown down.

10.text: I will not rouse him, as the cruel would do, for who is able to withstand my countenance?

11.text: Who has given to me beforehand, so that I should repay him? All things that are under heaven are mine.

12.text: I will not spare him, nor his powerful words and counterfeit attempts at supplication.

13.text: Who can reveal the beauty of his garment? And who can enter the middle of his mouth?

14.text: Who can open the doors of his face? I gave fear to the circle of his teeth.

15.text: His body is like shields fused together, like dense scales pressed over one another.

16.text: One is joined to another, and not even air can pass between them.

17.text: They adhere to one another, and they hold themselves in place and will not be separated.

18.text: His sneezing has the brilliance of fire, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

19.text: Lamps proceed from his mouth, like torches of fire burning brightly.

20.text: Smoke passes out of his nostrils, like a pot that is heated and boiling.

21.text: His breath causes coal to burn, and a flame comes forth from his mouth.

22.text: Strength dwells in his neck, and destitution goes before his presence.

23.text: The parts of his body work in harmony together. He will send lightning bolts against him, and they will not be carried to another place.

24.text: His heart will be as hard as a stone and as dense as a blacksmithâ€™s anvil.

25.text: When he will be raised up, the angels will be afraid, and, because they are terrified, they will purify themselves.

26.text: When a sword catches up with him, it will not be able to settle in, nor a spear, nor a breastplate.

27.text: For he will consider iron as if it were chaff, and brass as if it were rotten wood.

28.text: The archer will not cause him to flee; the stones of the sling have been turned into stubble for him.

29.text: He will treat the hammer as if it were stubble, and he will ridicule those who brandish the spear.

30.text: The beams of the sun will be under him, and he will dispense gold to them as if it were clay.

31.text: He will make the depths of the sea boil like a pot, and he will set it to bubble just as ointments do.

32.text: A path will shine after him; he will esteem the abyss as if it were weakening with age.

33.text: There is no power on the earth that is being compared to him, who has been made so that he fears no one.

34.text: He sees every prominent thing; he is king over all the sons of arrogance.
